content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-109-07-B
|Item_parent=Gait and balance disorders
|Item_parent_short=Gait and balance disorders
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the aetiologies of astasia-abasia
|Description=None
|Rubric=Etiologies
|Contributors=
|Order=7}}
- Psychogenic astasia abasia (depressive syndrome, sliding syndrome)

- Secondary astasia-abasia (non-psychogenic): apraxia of walking or frontal ataxia

properties.question: What is a common non-psychogenic cause of astasia-abasia?
properties.option_a: Psychogenic stress leading to temporary balance issues.
properties.option_b: Apraxia of walking or frontal ataxia.
properties.option_d: Muscular dystrophy affecting lower limb strength.
